hero.subtitle: Custom, responsive website – a confident presence from the start that attracts clients and is a long-term profitable investment.

about.heading: About Me
about.description:
Hi! I'm glad you're here. As a frontend developer, I help turn your ideas into real, well-functioning, and visually clean websites – whether you're an individual entrepreneur or representing a newly emerging brand.

In my work, I place great emphasis on responsiveness, fast loading, and ensuring that the site provides a convincing experience on every screen size. Whether it's a portfolio page, service overview, or creative landing page, it's important to me that the end result reflects the client's personality and goals.

I'm well-versed in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript languages, work with Bootstrap and Laravel frameworks, and continuously expand my knowledge. I've already created several websites on commission, and I also develop through personal projects – because I believe that learning never stops.

I adapt flexibly to needs and always strive to make collaboration smooth, trust-based, and successful. If you want a website that not only looks good but also works efficiently, you're in the right place.

Check out my work, and if you like what you see, feel free to contact me! Let's discuss what you need and build something that really works – and is tailored to you.

career_about.heading: Why am I the right choice?
career_about.description:
Hi! If you're looking for a developer who doesn't just code but creates real value, you're in the right place. I acquired my knowledge through a structured, project-based learning path where I mastered every skill through real tasks.

On the Scrimba Front-End Developer career path, I completed 70+ hours of interactive training videos, 100+ coding exercises, and dozens of real projects. This wasn't just theoretical knowledge, but practical experience – from blackjack games to React applications.

What makes my approach special is that I learned every technology in small steps, through projects. I don't just know how to use CSS Grid – I also know when and why it's worth applying. The same goes for JavaScript, React, or responsive design.

If you're looking for a developer who knows the answer to the 'why' question and creates value with every line of code, let's talk!

hero.subtitle: Project-based expertise, structured solutions, reliable collaboration.

2019.title: Foundation Building
2019.desc: HTML5 and CSS3 mastery – semantic elements, box model, responsive design basics.

2020.title: JavaScript Mastery
2020.desc: ES6+ syntax, DOM manipulation, async/await – practical projects: Blackjack game, Chrome extension.

2021.title: UI/UX and Responsive Design
2021.desc: Flexbox, CSS Grid, mobile-first thinking – complex layouts and visual hierarchy creation.

2022.title: React and Modern Development
2022.desc: Component-based architecture, state management, React Router – Todo App, blog application building.

2023-2024.title: Real Projects and Professional Experience
2023-2024.desc: Client project implementation, teamwork, agile methodologies application in practice.

courses.heading: Learning Path in Detail
courses.intro: The Scrimba Front-End Developer career path is a 70+ hour interactive, project-based learning program where I mastered every skill through real tasks.

basic.title: 1. Basic Level – Web Dev Basics & CSS
basic.desc:
HTML5 semantic elements, CSS3 basics and box model, responsive mobile-first thinking, Flexbox and CSS Grid introduction.
Projects: Living the Simple Life blog, BBQ Splash Page, responsive portfolio pages.

intermediate.title: 2. Intermediate – Interactive JavaScript
intermediate.desc:
Modern ES6+ syntax, DOM manipulation, asynchronous operations (fetch, async/await), Promise handling.
Projects: Blackjack game, Chrome Dashboard extension, Pac-Man prototype, modal components.

advanced.title: 3. Advanced – UI Design & Advanced Layouts
advanced.desc:
UI Design principles (white space, contrast, typography), complex Grid and Flexbox layouts, Tailwind CSS.
Projects: Photo Gallery, Pokedex, Jeopardy game, responsive library application.

react.title: 4. React & Modern Development
react.desc:
Functional components, hooks (useState, useEffect), React Router 6, state management, component composition.
Projects: Todo App multi-phase development, blog application with authentication system, Pokedex React integration.

learningProjects.heading: Learning Projects
learningProjects.intro: Projects created during Scrimba courses and self-practice - stepping stones of development.

professionalProjects.intro: Client works that serve real needs.

contact.heading: Let's Connect
contact.intro: Have an idea or want to start a website? Write to me, and together we'll create what you really need.
contact.phoneNote: Available on weekdays between 9:00 AM and 6:00 PM.

fullSite.title: Complete Website Development
fullSite.desc: Modern, responsive websites according to your ideas – from basics or based on existing concepts.

frontendDev.title: Frontend Development
frontendDev.desc: Clean, structured HTML, CSS and JavaScript-based development that looks good and works well.

responsive.title: Mobile-Friendly Design
responsive.desc: Design that adapts to every screen size, ensuring visitors have a good experience anywhere.

structuredCode.title: Structured Code
structuredCode.desc: Transparent, reusable and easily maintainable code – planned for the long term.

animations.title: Animations and Interactions
animations.desc: Subtle effects, hover animations and scroll solutions that bring the site to life.

support.title: Technical Support
support.desc: Bug fixes, updates, follow-up assistance – reliable support even after development.

step1.title: Consultation
step1.desc: We discuss your ideas, needs, and goals so everything is tailored to your business.

step2.title: Planning
step2.desc: I create the website wireframe and style directions – thoughtfully designed from UX/UI perspective.

step3.title: Development
step3.desc: I create tested, responsive code with modern animations and clean frontend.

step4.title: Delivery
step4.desc: I make the final touches and support you in usage, and if needed, in further developments.
